subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * In {{w|Written Chinese|modern Chinese}} scripts, Japanese {{w|kanji}} and Vietnamese {{w|History of writing in Vietnam|Nôm}}, the two strokes in the component {{l|mul|习}} are written in opposite directions ({{l|mul|冫}}). * In Korean {{w|hanja}}, the two strokes in the component {{l|mul|习}} are written in the same direction ({{l|mul|丿}}), which is also the historical form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}. * A {{w|CJK Compatibility Ideographs|CJK compatibility ideograph}} exists at U+FA1E for the historical form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}.

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[feather]], [[plume]]
# [[wing]]
# {{lb|zh|music}} fifth note in the Chinese pentatonic scale, or ''la''
